an4.174:4.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita,
an4.174:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Ānanda sat down to one side,
an4.174:5.1: “Reverend, when these six fields of contact have faded away and ceased with nothing left over, does anything else exist?”
an4.174:9.1: “Do both something else and nothing else exist?”
an4.174:11.1: “Do neither something else nor nothing else exist?”
an4.174:13.1: “Reverend, when asked these questions, you say ‘not so’.
an4.174:13.9: … How then should we see the meaning of this statement?”
an4.174:14.1: “If you say that ‘When the six fields of contact have faded away and ceased with nothing left over, something else exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:14.2: “If you say that ‘… nothing else exists’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:14.3: “If you say that ‘both something else and nothing else exist’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:14.4: “If you say that ‘both something else and nothing else exist’, you’re proliferating the unproliferated.
an4.174:14.5: The scope of the six fields of contact extends as far as the scope of proliferation.
an4.174:14.6: The scope of proliferation extends as far as the scope of the six fields of contact.
an4.174:14.7: When the six fields of contact fade away and cease with nothing left over, proliferation stops and is stilled.”
